page.title: 10CHURCHES IN HENFIELD.
page.content: St. Peter's Sunday School, Henfield. I go to St. Peter's Sunday School. I think it is good because we learn about God and Jesus. We have a little leaflet which has a story on it. At the end of the story we have to tell our teacher in what ways Jesus helps. We go to the Church Service every first Sunday of each month. At Christmas we do plays and perform them on Christmas Eve. This is by Kim. St. Peter's Church, Woodmancote. The Church is quite small. If you go inside you get the real feeling of a cosy place. It is one of the Churches in my Dad's Parish. It has a very small Church House. Nearby there is an Old People's Home for retired Clergy, called Terry's Cross. The Church has one bell in a small steeple. It is an old Church which is built in a L-shape. This is by Paul.
